intro: Lepidium xylodes, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Lepidium xylodes is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
